name: Kung Pao Chicken
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
cooking_method: Heat oil in a wok over high heat.
Add chicken and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, until browned.
Add garlic, ginger, and chili flakes and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add bell peppers and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix together soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, and cornstarch.
Add the sauce to the wok and stir-fry until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken and vegetables.
Stir in the peanuts and serve hot.

name: Hot and Sour Soup
cooking_method: In a pot, bring the chicken stock to a boil.
Add the bamboo shoots, mushrooms, tofu, soy sauce, rice vinegar, chili flakes, and sesame oil.
Simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Mix together cornstarch and water in a separate bowl.
Slowly pour the cornstarch mixture into the soup, stirring constantly until the soup thickens.
Slowly pour the beaten eggs into the soup, stirring gently to create egg ribbons.
Serve hot.

name: Beef with Broccoli
cooking_method: Heat oil in a wok over high heat.
Add beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until browned.
Add garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add broccoli and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix together soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, and sugar.
Add the sauce to the wok and stir-fry until the sauce thickens and coats the beef and broccoli.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Ma Po Tofu
ingredients: 1 lb soft or silken tofu, cut into 1-inch cubes
cooking_method: In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, chicken broth, cornstarch, and water. Set aside.
Heat a wok over high heat. Add vegetable oil, then add ground pork and stir-fry until browned and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.
Add Sichuan peppercorns, ginger, garlic, and green onions to the wok and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add chili bean paste to the wok and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Pour in the soy sauce mixture and bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens.

Add tofu to the wok and stir gently to coat with the sauce. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. Serve hot with rice.

name: Mapo Eggplant
ingredients: 1 lb Chinese eggplant, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 tbsp Sichuan peppercorns, toasted and ground
cooking_method: In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, chicken broth, cornstarch, and water. Set aside.
. Heat a wok over high heat. Add vegetable oil, then add ground pork and stir-fry until browned and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.
Add chili bean paste, ginger, garlic, and green onions to the wok and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add eggplant to the wok and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until tender.
Pour in the soy sauce mixture and bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens.
Sprinkle ground Sichuan peppercorns over the top of the dish and serve hot with rice.

name: Hainanese Chicken Rice
cooking_method: Rinse the chicken under cold running water and pat dry. Rub the chicken with salt and set aside.
. Rinse the rice under cold running water until the water runs clear. Drain the rice and transfer it to a rice cooker.
Add sesame oil, garlic, ginger, pandan leaves (if using), salt, and sugar to the rice cooker. Mix well.
Add chicken broth to the rice cooker and stir well. Place the chicken on top of the rice mixture.
Cover the rice cooker and cook the rice according to the manufacturer's instructions.
In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, oyster sauce, and white pepper. Set aside.
Once the rice cooker beeps, remove the chicken from the rice cooker and place it on a cutting board. Let it rest for 5 minutes.
Slice the chicken into bite-sized pieces and arrange them on a serving platter. Garnish with green onions and cilantro.
Serve the chicken with the rice and the soy sauce mixture on the side.

name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallions
ingredients: 1 lb whole fish, such as tilapia or sea bass
cooking_method: Clean the fish and place it on a plate.
In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce and Shaoxing wine. Pour the mixture over the fish.
Scatter ginger and green onions on top of the fish.
In a wok or a steamer, bring water to a boil. Place the plate with the fish on top of a steaming rack and place it in the wok or steamer.
Cover the wok or steamer and steam the fish for 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through.

In a small saucepan, heat up vegetable oil until hot. Pour it over the ginger and green onions on the fish.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallions
ingredients: 1 lb whole fish, such as tilapia or sea bass
cooking_method: Clean the fish and place it on a plate.

Cover the wok or steamer and steam the fish for 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through.

In a small saucepan, heat up vegetable oil until hot. Pour it over the ginger and green onions on the fish.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.
